data.title: Best Burger in Town
data.text: This place has my favorite burger in town, always friendly, perfectly cooked, and the atmosphere is something else. Give this restaurant a try, you won't be disappointed also the beers on tap from Mothers brewing company is always amazing!

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Have been here twice in the past month. Loved the wrap! My friend's Salad was huge-she split it before she dug in and then, after she ate on it, it still looked like a full bowl.

data.title: Highly recommended by locals
data.text: We went here because the locals all said this was a great spot for lunch and we were not disappointed. The place has a cool feel of your local watering hole, where people come regularly and do so because of the great service and food. If you are in Springfield this is definitely a great place to try.

data.title: Favorite lunch spot.
data.text: Best Banana cake & their italian wrap is wonderful, last soup I have was Lima bean soup, I really love the atmosphere

data.title: Has Management Changed recently?
data.text: I use to love this place. Now it looks like no one cares about the appearance or service. The inside was WAY too dark - we were not even sure it was open from the outside. The manager chose to keep the entire middle row of lights turned off - maybe to hide the dirt??? (it did not add to the ambiance). Some poor guy trying to see what beers were on tap could not read the handles because it was so dark behind the bar. The chalk board that was supposed to list the beers on tap only had 2 beers listed on it (and only the brewer - not the actual beer) and the chalk board for the canned beers is there why? (it was completely erased - but not cleaned) There was only one waitress and she was not in a hurry to get drinks to us or take care of the 3 tables she had (and this was on a Friday night). Perhaps the unreliable hours or the change in some of the menu items (the smoked salmon sandwich use to be amazing - no longer the case) has quit bringing people in. So sad because it use to be one of my favorite places to eat.

data.title: Huge salads
data.text: They have variety on the menu, but the salads are amazing! They are huge and come with a side of bread. You will not leave hungry ordering the salad here. There is typically not a long wait to be served and the service is friendly and fast.

data.title: One of my Fav places for a freshly made salad!
data.text: The reg side salad is a nice size and if only salads everywhere were this good!  I usually go for the Blue cheese dressing but the house is also good.  The salad comes with Gorgonzola cheese and roasted sunflower seeds already in there ~ Yummy!  Today I had the traditional grilled chicken ~ see pic.  It was good but the reg salad / no chicken is my favorite.  The bread is so so but I'm not a fan of bread.  I'll be back and I recommend!

data.title: Super fun and good food
data.text: Love their salads and if you are a burger fan they are good also. Don't miss the banana cake. Great decide celebrating local athletes - kinda like 'Cheers' but not a bar ( although you can get beer and wine ) if your party is large get reservations

data.title: I used to really like this place....
data.text: So, I took my out-of-town boss to lunch the other day.   I chose St. Michaels, because the food is pretty good.   I won't do that again, because there is a serious problem with the service.   After being seated & drink & order taken, we waited for 45 min. No food.   The table next to me (who sat down 15 min AFTER we arrived) were already half-way thru their meal   I walk up to the cook/owner, who tells me, "oh, your waitress just now turned in the order..sorry."   So we left. Doubt I'll be back anytime soon, because I really don't like being embarrassed in front of my boss. It's a shame too - a great downtown burger!

data.title: Liked it!  The Salad we had was very good.
data.text: My wife and I went on on a Sat afternoon.  I had the Cesar chicken salad.  My wife had the salad with turkey and cap ham on it.  She loved it.  I tried hers and wish I had ordered it.  The salads are really big.  Not sure I liked the seasoning on my Cesar. The chicken was hot and didn't complement my cold greens.  My wife's was perfection!!  Will go again and try other items.

data.title: Really good sandwiches and salads
data.text: Everything is made fresh to order. I had the blackened salmon sandwich and tomato bisque. Both were wonderful. Be sure to try a salad with the balsamic vinaigrette.

data.title: Can't beat their soup
data.text:
I used to work in downtown Springfield and we would come here on a cool, rainy day to have their soup.  It's made-from-scratch and so very well seasoned.  My favorite is their Italian wedding soup.  The bowl just isn't big enough!  Hubby and I ate here the other day.  It was his first time and he had a cheeseburger and loved it.  I had the buffalo salad special which was good but a little spicy for me.  Part of the special was soup and I wanted to try the lima bean soup.  I didn't have good memories of lima beans, but this soup was outstanding.  All new memories!  I skipped the salad and ate all the soup with some bread.  Yum!  I took the salad home and finished it the next day.  Didn't seem as spicy.  

I'm not sure why this isn't rated higher.  Maybe not enough soup lovers writing reviews.  As the weather cools, I'm looking forward to going back again.

data.title: My favorite salad in Springfield
data.text: Ok, I know this is a burger joint, and yes, their burgers are delish, but their caribbean chicken salad is seriously one of the best meal salads I've ever had. You get a huge salad with lots of fresh chicken, seasoned perfectly, AND bread. (because seriously, who really wants to eat only a salad for lunch?) I just love it and crave it all the time.

data.title: Not the best
data.text: Chicken sandwich was worst I ever had. Still went back a second time with coworkers and didn't enjoy then place yet again. Bad service- they're very busy which amazes me because I didn't like anything there. Go to Nonnas across the street!

data.title: Best Banana Cake
data.text: Absolutely one of the best desserts I've ever enjoyed at a restaurant. The banana cake is so incredible and I stop by the restaurant just to enjoy a slice. The salads are also my favorite because they are big and full of fresh ingredients.

data.title: Excellent salads at lunch
data.text: Jenny and the rest of the crew always do an excellent job. Simple and straight forward food. Burgers are always good and beer is always cold.

data.title: Excellent downtown restaurant!
data.text: Great atmosphere in the heart of downtown Springfield. Fresh vibrant feel, excellent service, beautifully simple menu. Easily one of the best casual restaurants downtown.

data.title: Our "go to" place
data.text: We have been going to St. Michaels since October of 2007.  When we want to go out, and can't decide where it St. Michaels.  There beer selection is great as is the food.  My favs are Meatball Sub and Italian dip, both reasonably priced.  Love the environment and wait staff.

data.title: Good burgers, drinks and salads
data.text: Is a tough call here whether to get a burger or a salad, both are very good. Their salads are among the best in Sgf for the money

data.title: I love this place!
data.text:
I visit this pace at least once every weekend. The atmosphere is friendly. The staff is amazing. The food is great and the price is reasonable.
They have the best soup, salads and wraps in town.
If you like people watching you won't find a better spot downtown.
